description: Borrowed from Latin dēterreō (“deter, discourage”), from de (“from”) + terreō (“I frighten”).

verbs.description: deter (third-person singular simple present deters, present participle deterring, simple past and past participle deterred)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To persuade someone not to do something; to discourage.
examples: Their boss deterred them from both taking holidays at the same time, claiming he couldn't manage it all on his own.
we have in following enquiry, attempted to throw some light upon subjects, from which uncertainty has hitherto deterred the wise
